instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS: What is PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS? Power rail on 820-2850 logic board for the GPU framebuffer, that is often underpowered and intermittent because of a dying C9560 capacitor that must be replaced on this model to avoid black screen & kernel panics..
definitions.PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R: What is PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R? Power rail on 820-2850 logic board for the GPU framebuffer, that is often underpowered and intermittent because of a dying C9560 capacitor that must be replaced on this model to avoid black screen & kernel panics..
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: I got this board today, I was a able to get video out of it once out of probably 15 power cycles. It does chime every power cycle. I ran out of time today at work to start measuring power rails. Am I correct in thinking this is a 330uf tantalum cap problem (<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>)? Or at least a good starting point?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: Replace <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> first, but I doubt that will be it. Try a known good LCD assembly too and disconnect the battery indicator.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: I replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, and also just got my known good screen, still same issue not able to get image or backlight. I get chime every time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message:
Does it work with an external screen?
I had similar symptoms on a different board. Take a look from <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>; around L9000, L9010, L9011 area.

I had a corroded L9080 (your board doesn't have this particular part no.) which was near the DC Adapter. Classic moisture / liquid damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: Yes, check external video and then check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>, should be 3.3V .Then check power to pin 4 6 and 7 of LCD connector. Measure them in diode mode too, with and without LCD plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message:
External video does not work,
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> Probe

 <RESISTOR>R5071</RESISTOR>  3.3v



w/ screen
PIN 4 = 3.2v
PIN 6 = 3.2v
PIN 7 = 3.2v

Diode Mode

PIN 4 =  0.27
PIN 6 =  0.45
PIN 7 = 0.46

W/o Screen

PIN 4 = 3.3v 
PIN 6 = 3.2v
PIN 7 = 3.2v

Diode Mode

PIN 4 = 0.27
PIN 6 = 0.45
PIN 7 = 0.45

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message:
Hmmm, you should get video externally with VGA or HDMI adapter at least if you leave internal LCD disconnected. 
Try heating up the GPU to about 100C and try again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message:
Heated the gpu up to 100c, tried again issue remains.

An observation I made when I had the board out is that after the chime the fans rev up to full speed and remain there they do not throttle down. This was happening before and after heating the board. Dont know if that mean anything to this issue.

I did try external video again after heating with and without the lvds cable plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message:
Any history on this board? GPU not messed with? It's worrying that you were able to get video at one stage, usually does not bode well. GPU getting power?
Try pressing on the MUX chip and powering on too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: The board looks un-sodomized no signs of previous work. I have not done anything to it besides what we have discussed. Out of probably over 100 power cycles since I have been testing it I have maybe gotten video 5 times. Ill let you know on the MUX/GPU stuff. Thanks Duke!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message:
Decided to take keep messing with this board. I took some measurements regarding the GPU power, I also tried pushing on the MUX while powering it on. 

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0GPU</SIGNAL> = 1.05v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 1.33v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R</SIGNAL> = 1.33v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_GPUIFPX</SIGNAL> = 1.78v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> = 3.28v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> = 0.9v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX</SIGNAL> = 0.87v



LVDS connector 

PINS 2&3 - 3.2v

PINS 39&40 - 24.9v

Machine continues to power on and chime. After about 5 seconds the fans go to 100% and just sit there with no video. Any other suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: 3V on pin 2 and 3 suggests there IS an image on the LCD! 24V on backlight means there is just no backlight......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: You are correct sir my apologies for confusing the situation. I can usually see the image with my nake eye but this time I had to use a flash light to see the blinking folder but it is there. So to figure out why I have no back light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chimes No backlight or image
threads.message: <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR>? Did you do a PRAM reset?
